title: 113_s1719
content: The "Poison Center Network Act" authorizes appropriations for the maintenance of the nationwide toll-free phone number and a media campaign to promote poison control center utilization for fiscal years 2015 through 2019. SEC. 4. REAUTHORIZATION OF THE POISON CONTROL CENTER GRANT PROGRAM. The Public Health Service Act is amended to enhance the nation's poison control centers' communication and response capabilities. The Public Health Service Act is amended to improve poison control centers' communication and response capabilities by integrating and modernizing their communications and data systems, including enhancing telephony, Internet, data, and social networking technologies. Subsection (c) heading is changed from "Certification" to "Accreditation." The Public Health Service Act is amended to improve poison control centers' communication and response capabilities by integrating and modernizing their communications and data systems, including enhancing telephony, Internet, data, and social networking technologies. Subsection (d) is updated to replace "Certification" with "Accreditation" throughout the text. In subsection (C), the last sentence is removed and the time limit is extended to 5 or 6 years for non-accredited poison control centers. Subsection (f) is revised for funding activities, and subsection (g) authorizes appropriations of $28,600,000 annually from 2015 to 2019. The amendments made by subsection (a) will take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act and apply to grants from October 1, 2014 onwards.
